org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api.query

Interface ChronoDBQuery

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChronoDBQueryImpl

    public interface ChronoDBQuery
    A ChronoDBQuery is a query that can be executed against a ChronoDB instance.

    Instances of classes implementing this interface are usually produced by feeding a QueryTokenStream to a QueryParser via QueryParser.parse(QueryTokenStream).

    Please note that all instances of classes that implement this interface are assumed to be immutable!

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getKeyspace()
      Returns the keyspace on which this query should be executed.
      QueryElement getRootElement()
      Returns the root QueryElement in the Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) of the query.

    • Method Detail

      • getKeyspace

        java.lang.String getKeyspace()
        Returns the keyspace on which this query should be executed.
        Returns:
        The name of the keyspace. Never null.

      • getRootElement

        QueryElement getRootElement()
        Returns the root QueryElement in the Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) of the query.
        Returns:
        The AST root element. Never null.
